Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  give a short general description of (sth). 概括；概述
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We outlined our main objections to the proposal.

Vocabularies.Definition: 在…开始时
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We are only at the start of our job-hunting.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a thing that is suggested or implied; a thing that is not openly stated 含意；暗示
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He smiled, with the implication that he didn't believe me.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  by that means or action 因此，由此，从而
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He became a citizen, thereby gaining the right to vote.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. that can be done; possible 可行的；可能的；有理的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It is not feasible to follow your proposals.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be done, achieved, etc. 现实的，实际的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She gave us a realistic appraisal of our chances.

Vocabularies.Definition: 与…合作，与…协同
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The report was produced by the Government in cooperation with the chemical industry.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad., a. (French) on the way; while traveling 在途中（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We are en route to the museum.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  any of the parts of which sth. is made 元件，组件；部件，零件
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Blade and handle are the component parts of a knife.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   of different kinds; varied 多种多样的；形形色色的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her interests are very diverse.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. lasting or expected to last for a long time or for ever 永久的；持久的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She is looking for permanent employment.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   put (sth.) into effect; carry (sth.) out 贯彻；执行；实施
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The committee's decision will be implemented immediately.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a thing, amount, word, etc. that is equal in value, importance, etc. 相等物；等价物 e.g.  Is there a French word that is the exact equivalent of the English word "home"?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Is there a French word that is the exact equivalent of the English word "home"?

Vocabularies.Definition: a. suitable, acceptable or correct in the circumstances 适当的，恰当的，相称的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His casual clothes were not appropriate for such a formal occasion.

Vocabularies.Definition: by using (sth.); with the help of (sth.) 用，依靠
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We crossed the stream by means of a log.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   the action or process of fitting together the parts of sth. 装配，组装
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  About 50 people are working on this assembly line.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  暴露，显露
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He nearly died of exposure on the cold mountain.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   become or make (sb./sth.) mature （使）成熟，（使）长成
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child's judgment matures as she grows older.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the bringing of (sth.) into use or operation for the first time 采用；引进
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The introduction of new advanced techniques in the factory is under discussion today.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  interpret or understand (sth.) in a certain way 把…看作，认为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I perceived his comment as a challenge.
